content: The Act is titled the "Griffith Project Prepayment and Conveyance Act" and includes definitions for various terms used within the Act. The Act defines the "Authority" as the Southern Nevada Water Authority and the "Griffith Project" as the Robert B. Griffith Water Project authorized under the Southern Nevada Water Project Act. The term "Acquired Land(s)" refers to all interests in land acquired under Public Law 89-292, including fee title, right(s)-of-way, and easement(s). The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of the Interior. Public Law 89-292, as amended, defines terms such as "Secretary" as the Secretary of the Interior, "Acquired Land(s)" as all interests in land acquired for the Griffith Project, "Public Land" as lands under the Bureau of Land Management, and "Withdrawn Land" as Federal lands withdrawn from certain uses. The term "Withdrawn Land" refers to Federal lands withdrawn from settlement, sale, mineral location, or entry under general land laws for a specific public purpose. These lands are under the jurisdiction of the Bureau of Reclamation or the National Park Service. SEC. 3. CONVEYANCE OF GRIFFITH PROJECT. The Authority will assume liability for the Griffith Project from the United States upon prepayment of $121,204,348. The Secretary will convey all rights and interests in the project to the Authority. Upon prepayment of $121,204,348, the Secretary will transfer all rights, title, and interest in improvements, facilities, Acquired Lands, and reserved interests for the Griffith Project to the Authority as per the provisions of the Act. The Authority will acquire all interests and rights for the Griffith Project from the United States, including reserved interests in lands patented by the United States. The Authority will have a right-of-way across Public Land, Withdrawn Land, and Federal lands necessary for the operation and maintenance of the Griffith Project. The Authority will have a right-of-way across Public Land, Withdrawn Land, and Federal lands for the Griffith Project's operation and maintenance without payment of rental fees. Within twelve months, the Secretary and the Authority will agree on the land description for the established rights-of-way. The Secretary and the Authority will agree on the land description for the established rights-of-way within twelve months. If the conveyance has not occurred within this timeframe, the Secretary will report to Congress on the status of the conveyance. The Secretary and the Authority may modify existing contracts and permits to comply with this Act. This Act does not affect other laws or future benefits. Upon conveyance of the Griffith Project, all applicable laws and regulations must be followed. The lands and facilities transferred will no longer receive Reclamation benefits as a Federal Reclamation Project. Upon conveyance of the Griffith Project, transferred lands will no longer receive Reclamation benefits as a Federal Reclamation Project.
